intro: Rhexia bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland habitats. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a hairy underside. Rhexia bicornis is often found in shaded areas and is an important nectar source for pollinators.
